alert.note: Alert for Codington; Deuel; Grant; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 1:34PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: Locally strong and gusty winds are expected along the eastern slopes of the Prairie Coteau tonight into Sunday. South- southwesterly winds of 20 to 35 mph with occasional gusts of 40 to 50 mph will develop. The locations most affected will be the higher terrain areas of the Sisseton Hills near Veblen down to near Clear Lake, as well as up to 15 miles east of the hills. This includes Interstate 29 between Summit and Peever, or between mile markers 210 and 225. U.S. Highway 12 from Summit to Milbank and U.S. Highway 212 from near Kranzburg to near Marietta, MN may also experience these strong winds. These winds will promote blowing and drifting snow, along with visibility reduced to less than a mile. At times, very low visibility of less than one half mile could occur. Anyone with travel plans across far northeast South Dakota should be prepared for inclement weather and are urged to slow down and allow for extra distance between vehicles if need be.
